title: hyperlinks in messages don't open browser
content:
Hi, I hope you can help me with a problem I’m having. When I click on a hyperlink in a message, the link is hi-lighted but the browser does not load. If I right click on the hyperlink, a window pops up and I can choose among options to open link in browser or copy link and a couple of others. Open link in browser gives the same results as clicking on the hyperlink. If I click on copy link, I can then bring the browser up myself and paste and go and everything works as it should. I should note that I can click on links to other programs and they open as expected. I copied a hyperlink to a browser to a word document and when I clicked on it, the browser did open. I have changed default browsers and restarted the computer and Thunderbird to no effect. I looked at your general trouble-shooting guide and went through the first three steps and everything seems to be ok. I had this problem a year or so ago and it just went away after some time had passed. This time it’s been a couple of weeks. Any ideas? Stephen Niver

Application Basics Name Thunderbird Version 128.5.2esr Build ID 20241210220830 Distribution ID Update Channel esr User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Thunderbird/128.5.2 OS Windows_NT 10.0 19045 Launcher Process Enabled Multiprocess Windows 0/0 Fission Windows 0/0 Enabled by default Remote Processes 1 Enterprise Policies Inactive Google Location Service Key Missing Google Safebrowsing Key Missing Mozilla Location Service Key Missing Safe Mode false Memory Size (RAM) 3.9 GB Disk Space Available 16.8 GB Mail and News Accounts ID Name Incoming server Outgoing servers Name Connection security Authentication method Identity Name Connection security Authentication method Default? account1 Local Folders (none) Local Folders 0 passwordCleartext account2 sniver@comcast.net (pop3) mail.comcast.net:995 SSL passwordCleartext Stephen <sniver@comcast.net> smtp.comcast.net:465 SSL passwordCleartext true account8 stevegowf@gmail.com (imap) imap.gmail.com:993 SSL OAuth2 me <stevegowf@gmail.com> smtp.gmail.com:465 SSL OAuth2 true account9 sniverext@comcast.net (pop3) mail.comcast.net:995 SSL passwordCleartext Stephen Niver <sniverext@comcast.net> smtp.comcast.net:465 SSL passwordCleartext true

title: Thunderbird 128.5.2esr (Ubuntu 24.04) hangs after a few minutes completely
content:
Hello,

I use Thunderbird 128.5.2esr with xubuntu 24.04.

All of a sudden (I haven't changed anything) thunderbird hangs completely after a few minutes running. The process does not react at all, I have to kill it. Thunderbird process is then stuck on 100% load.

Already testet (with no success):

  • Troubleshooting Mode with deactivated Addons
  • Disabled Global Indexing (with deleting global-messages-db.sqlite file)
  • Waiting for 20min (in case thread/process is running a long time)
  • Reboot OS

I have no idea what the issue is. Does anyone have ideas? Thx, Hugo

title: Continuous sign-in attempts for removed account
content:
Hello,

I recently closed a Gmail account and removed it from Thunderbird however it continues to periodically attempt to connect to Google with the deleted account's identity.

Under Account Settings, the account has been removed and the Outgoing Server entry has been deleted. All Saved Logins for the deleted account have been removed. There are no calendars configured for the removed account. There are no extensions installed other than LookOut 6.3 which does not appear to be account-sensitive.

If it makes a difference, I am experiencing this with Thunderbird 128.5.2esr (64-bit) on Slackware Linux 15.0.

Short of burning the profile and creating a new one, I'm out of ideas. Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Cheers,

-d.

title: Universal Inbox Includes All Subfolders
content:
I recently updated Thunderbird and it seems the universal inbox now includes all subfolders. I, of course, just want the universal inbox to include the inbox folders of my various accounts. I understand that I can right click the universal inbox and click 'Choose' to manually unselect the folders but I have hundreds of subfolders over many email accounts and it's an extremely tedious process. I am also setting up several computers.

So, a few solutions I have thought of: 1- Is there a way to change the universal inbox to include only the top level inbox? 2- Is there a way to change the default universal inbox to include nothing and I manually select the inbox folder(s)? 3- Could a 'select none' button be added on the 'Choose folder' dialog?

On a related note, another annoying thing is now anytime I create a new subfolder it automatically is added to the universal inbox so I have to go to the properties, find it, and deselect it. Since I use several computers every time I create a new subfolder I have to repeat this process on each computer.

Thunderbird is still awesome - updates just changed this behavior and I find it very annoying. Thanks in advance!
creator: matthew.schmidtbauer

title: Trouble getting Mozilla Thunderbird to get and send emails
content:
I have recently had to have my computer operating system restored. I have a Windows 10 Pro 64 bit machine. My broadband provider is Grande Communications whose new name is Astound. Anyway, I cannot get my account (setblack@grandecom.net) to send or receive emails once I reloaded Thunderbird onto my machine. It is frustrating as the dickens as IMAP Server and SMPT Server both tell me that the certificate is not valid for my address/provider. I have put in the correct ports for both servers according to the information provided by Astound for users in Texas (I live in Austin). I suspect that my provider is the source of this situation but I am bound and determined to find a solution as I have used Firefox and Thunderbird for a good while.

It seems like I have had similar problems connecting to GrandeCommunications in the past. I can confirm security exemptions and check the box for Thunderbird to remember this confirmation. I must have figured it out at one point as I was using these programs till my machine bluescreened.

Thanks for any help and guidance you could pass on to me. I can check for your response via Webmail...
creator: setblack

title: When deleting 1 message in any folder all folders seem to become empty, but show up again after restarting TB
content:
Hello,

Last 2 months I'm facing a topic when I delete 1 message in any folder. After the deletion was executed not only the folder I deleted the message from, but all other folders in all my account + Local Folders become empty.

The only remedy to get the folder contents back it to close and restart TB. Most of the times this topic occurs when deleting the most recent mail in a folder, but it is not aloways the case.

This topic is extremely annoying because I need too restart TB at least 10-15 times per day, and it makes TB in fact a unworkable application. I'm currently using TB v128.5.2esr (64-bits), but the described topic occured in at least 3-4 earlier releases too.

I can't believe I'm the only user who suffers from this topic, but couldn't find any other running thread on this topic. I personally would consider this topic to be a 'Blocker' to be solved a.s.a.p.
creator: Thunderbird2015

title: Thunderbird cannot connect to ISP mail server, cannot get mail
content: Thunderbird, quite suddenly, stopped getting my email; Both on my account and my wife's account at the same ISP. I spent more than two hours on the phone with the ISPs help line trying to resolve this issue. They also use Thunderbird at their help desk, and the agent I talked to was familiar with your program. She (the agent) was not able to replicate the issue on their system. We then tried to set up a NEW email account. I carefully entered all the info needed for a new account, following instructions from the agent, then hit the 'Test' button. I got the following message onscreen: "THUNDERBIRD FAILED TO FIND SETTINGS FOR YOUR EMAIL ACCOUNT" The answer to the original issue suddenly became very clear - Thunderbird cannot, or refuses to, connect with the email server, therefore NO EMAIL. We tried everything in her toolkit to resolve the problem to no avail. We finally tried UNINSTALLING Thunderbird (and the Maintaince program). Once Uninstalled, I used the Registry Tool on CCleaner to remove any entries in the registry referring to Thunderbird (there were several), then restarted my computer. I then downloaded and installed a totally NEW Thunderbird program. When I ran the Thunderbird again, I found all my account(s) info was still present, and Thunderbird was still unable to find the server. I'm at my wits end trying to resolve this issue, and REALLY HATE to go back to Microsoft OUTLOOK to get my email. Anybody got any ideas??? Any help would be greatly appreciated. (Signed) Proteus
creator: proteus2

title: Da alcuni giorni non ricevo più le email di Alice.it su mozilla thunderbindd
